title.narrative: Building the Western Saharan Civil Society of Tomorrow

description.narrative: The project will continue the activities started in 2014 aimed at strengthening the Western Saharan civil society and processes of democratic and peaceful conflict resolution. The target group is Sahrawi youth that live dispersed in different areas: occupi ed territories under Moroccan rule refugee camps in Algeria and diaspora mostly in Algeria and Europe. This dispersed group lacks the connections necessary to build a united civil society movement.The first objective of the project is to increase the youth participants? knowledge about democracy and political participation and increase their capacity in advocacy and networking. The project also strengthens networks between the Sahrawi youth and the youths? connections to civil society actors. The third obje ctive is to increase partner's capacity to continue organising the activities after the project. The last objective is to establish relationships of international solidarity and to support peer-to-peer-exchange between Sahrawi and Finnish youth. The activ ities of the continuation project are divided into four main activity types. In the first activity type facilitators? training for youth leading the workshops as well as training for the project partner in participatory methods will be carried out as a pa rt of the capacity-building of the partner. The second will comprise of the five workshops organised around the themes of democracy rule of law human rights and the building of civil society activities. The third will involve peer-to-peer models aimed at distributing the learned results and therefore broadening and deepening discussion on workshop themes. This part will also include monitoring of peer-to-peer activities through communications fora created by participants and Finnish project volunteers. Fin ally the fourth activity type will involve the strengthening of networking within Western Saharan civil society by bringing together Sahrawi and external civil society and organisation actors present in the camps during a final seminar that will close each workshop.The training and workshop activities will take place at the refugee camps in Tindouf. Peer-to-peer distribution activities will happen in all different locations where the youth live and in addition between the Sahrawi youth and Finns.
